_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accident Prevention and Response Policies



Lone Star Hattiesburg LLC, in Petal, Mississippi is a liquified petroleum gas (LPG)storage facility.  The LPG stored is butane.  The facility utilizes certain safety precautions to prevent unnecessary on-site human exposure and to minimize the potential for any offsite exposure.  These safety precautions include: 

 1. Effectively managing our process operations; 

 2. Investing in the latest process safety technologies; 

    training and retraining our personnel; 

 3. Reviewing our processes for hazards on a continuous basis; 

 4. Ensuring safety is considered in process design, installation, operations and 

    maintenance.  



The facility maintains a policy to be a good business partner; a safe and conscientious neighbor; and to operate in compliance with all applicable laws and regulations.





Description of the Stationary Source and Regulated Substances



The Lone Star Hattiesburg facility contains the RMP regulated flammable substance of  butane.  The maximum intended inventory assumes twenty two (22) rail cars are loaded and detached from their motive force, along with the five (5) large storage tanks.





The General Accident Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps



The Terminal Operations Manager has overall responsibility for ensuring that our facility operates in a safe and reliable manner.  However, all personnel ensure that safe work practices, equipment design specifications, and maintenance schedules are adhered to thereby reducing the probability of an accident at the facility.



Lone Star Hattiesburg LLC has developed programs to comply with all environmental, health, and safety laws.  Lone Star takes a systematic, proactive approach to preventing accidental releases.  Our risk management program addresses each of the essential features of successful accident prevention programs, including:

 1. Process Safety Information

 2. Process Hazard Analysis

 3. Operating P

rocedures

 4. Training

 5. Mechanical Integrity

 6. Management of Change

 7. Pre-Startup Safety Review

 8. Compliance Audits

 9. Incident Investigation

 10.Employee Partcipation

 11.Hot Work Permits

 12.Contractor Safety





The Lone Star Hattiesburg facility employs extensive mechanical integrity and preventative maintenance programs to ensure the integrity of the equipment and safety systems.  The mechanical integrity program uses equipment surveillance and preventative maintenance activities to identify equipment that may be deteriorating and in need of repair or replacement, before failure occurs.  This program also specifies the repairs and/or parts needed to return equipment to acceptable specifications.



The Lone Star Hattiesburg facility trains facility employees to safely perform their assigned tasks.  The training program includes initial training as well as periodic refresher training and training updates when major process or equipment changes are made.





Five-Year Accident History



The Lone Star Hattiesburg facility has not had any accidents that meet the criteria for the Five-Year Accident History.





Emergency Response Program



Lone Star Hattiesburg LLC is a member of the Petal Dome Mutual Aid (PDMA) group and the Forrest County LEPC.  The PDMA has an emergency response plan which details procedures for accidental releases and includes notification of the Forrest County LEPC and other local authorities.  We maintain an "open door" policy with local emergency response organizations to help ensure maximum understanding and cooperation during an emergency.





Planned Changes to Improve Safety



The Lone Star Hattiesburg personnel continually strive to improve all aspects of our safety programs to protect our workers and the public.
